widgets.value: Some things are not always same. for example, an effect applied on a track/some gruoup effect bypass button. if it is meant to be dynamic, use Midi buttons. it can easily be mapped in Resolume. If at a later time that control become usual/always used, then convert the control from midi to OSC so that it wont have to be remapped any more.

NoteOn event or noteOff if velocity equals `0`. oming noteOff events will be received as `/note` with velocity 0 if `note_off_velocity` is not set during [setup]

-   `channel`: integer between 1 and 16
-   `note`: integer between 0 and 127
-   `velocity`: integer between 0 and 127

A Push Button that sends note "on" and note "off" when pressed 
(like a pinao)

on: the velocity for piano press
off: 0 for Note_OFF
preArgs: 
        [ 
          channel#, 
          note#
        ]
   where 60 = C4

Control change event.

-   `channel`: integer between 1 and 16
-   `CC`: integer between 0 and 127
-   `value`: integer between 0 and 127

A Fader that sends its value when changed (channel 16, CC 0)
min: 0, max: 127
default value: 0 (double click)

OSC>preArgs: 
        [ 
          channel#, 
          CC#
        ]
Fader>DoubleTap: True

A Fader that sends its value when changed (channel 16, CC 0)
min: 0, max: 127
NO DEFAULT VALUE

OSC>preArgs: 
        [ 
          channel#, 
          CC#
        ]

A Fader that sends its value when changed (channel 16, CC 0)
min: 0, max: 127
DEFAULT 0, SPRINGS BACK

OSC>preArgs: 
        [ 
          channel#, 
          CC#
        ]
Fader>DoubleTap: True

A Fader that sends its value when changed (channel 16, CC 0)
min: 0, max: 127
DEFAULT 64 (middle), SPRINGS BACK

OSC>preArgs: 
        [ 
          channel#, 
          CC#
        ]
Fader>DoubleTap: True

Program change event.

-   `channel`: integer between 1 and 16
-   `program`: integer between 0 and 127

A button that sends ProgramChange when tapped (channel 16, CC 0)

OSC>preArgs: 
        [ 
          channel#, 
          program#
        ]

A button that sends ProgramChange when changed (channel 16, CC 0)

Switch>Values: Dictionary of labels and values
OSC>preArgs: 
        [ 
          channel#, 
          program#     < Dynamic, Change values list
        ]

A DropDown that sends ProgramChange when changed (channel 16, CC 0)

IF you want to CLONE but use the clone to control other things than the original one, 
make sure to make the ID dynamic using variables to make it unique

MAKE ID UNIQUE IF U WANT IT TO DO UNIQUE THING THAN PARENT

GROUP 1 DashBoard

Main Thing is the Address in the Prop:

here, each element have serially different #{$} which goes from 0 to n.

SelectedLayer DashBoard

Main Thing is the Address in the Prop:

here, each element have serially different #{$} which goes from 0 to n.

Group #{@{parent.id}.slice(-1)}
Dashboard

GROUP 1 DashBoard, Editable Package.
id = "/composition/groups/1"
for easier reference. 
INNER IDs ARE DYNAMIC, 
so, cloning will not cause conflict

GROUP 1 DashBoard, CLONED Package.
id = "/composition/groups/2"
SET VIA PROP
Layer #{@{parent.id}.slice(19)}

Layer 1 is editable component. that is cloned for layer 2-5.

All the components inside the layer 1 group have:
- Dynamic ID
- Dynamic address

Dynamic based on the @{parent.id}. that @{parent.id} is changed on every one of the cloner via "prop":
for example: (for layer 2, cloner 2)
{
  "id": "composition/layers/2"
}

Faders have default value of 0.5, accessible via doubeTap


All the buttons have their own attributes assigned via props:
{
  "mode": "tap",
  "typeTag": "i",
  "id": "#{@{parent.id}}/clips/#{$}/connect",
  "address": "/#{@{parent.id}}/clips/#{$+1}/connect",
  "label": "Clip #{$+1}"
}

================= PROPERTIES REFERENCE:

FOR OSC
{
	"id": "@{parent.id}/clips/#{$}/connect",		// make unique?
	"address": "@{parent.id}/clips/#{$}/connect",	// $ works only in props field
	"label": "Clip #{$+1}"							// same as above
	"value": 1,										// [optnl]
	"default": 0	// maybe not needed				// [optnl]
}

FOR MIDI
{
	"id": "@{parent.id}/clips/#{$}/connect", 	// make unique?
	"address": "/control",						// midi data type
	"preArgs": [ 16, 0 ], 						// channel, control 
	"target": "midi:OSC"						// midi device name
	"label": "Clip #{$+1}"
	"value": 1,									// [optnl]
	"default": 0								// [optnl]
}

Reference Itself 
(the matrix container)

id could be:
"id": "@{this.id}/clips/#{$}"
But removed because 
handled somehow automatically

widgets.label: @{parent.variables.n}

widgets.value:
This is an example LOGIC -----> 


1. if switch is turned off, knob will not send any midi message 
    (but you can change the knob value for later use)
2. when switch is turned on, the current value of the knob 
    will be sent through Midi
3. if switch is turned on, rotating the knob will send midi message.
4. when switch is turned off, the knob will not go to 0,
    instead it will keep showing its value.

You can hide the original logic box, or just move it in another place.
for example: 
- just hide
- hide it inside a modal
- hide it inside a tab (that tab will be hidden usually)
     this is done here.

because the matrix has cloners and 
cloner "visibility" is set to true,
the logicBox still shows up here.

cloning softFXCombo2_null, which is kept in a hidden tab
can be accessible via project tree panel
and temporarily made visible for modifications

Here is another copy, clone of softFXCombo3_null


for less wasted space/compact view, 
these things are modified:
PANEL:
- Style:
    - lineWidth: 0    
    - padding: 0
- PanelStyle:
    - contain: false
    - innerPadding: false   <- Do it last, for ez selection
    - scroll: false

This button can send value depending on mouse Y position. 
Higher up = closer to 1..
